data.name: String Interpolation
data.description:
Implement the function `render(template, values)` which takes a template string interpolates the embedded expressions. Each expression is wrapped in `{{brackets}}` and can be:

- Name of passed value (in the `values` object)
- Global variable name
- Literal value

If an expression can be evaluated as more than one, the priority follows the order of the above list (= values > global > literal). If the expression cannot be evaluted is considered as an undefined value.

```javascript
var name = "Katia";
render("{{name}} is a name with {{count}} letters", { count: name.length });
// > Katia is a name with 5 letters
```

Undefined values are ignored, but null values are printed.
